text: DAVID GREGORY: So

are things that the
president and the White House

have brought on themselves by
uttering untruths by talking

about phantom illegal
voters, by obsessing
about crowd size and ratings.

To Josh's point, you want to
take on all these problems,

you should focus on
leadership and less

about talking about dishonest
human beings in the media.

MATT LEWIS: Well, I think that--
I would say I think that--

CHRIS CUOMO: Last word.
Go ahead.

MATT LEWIS: Look, I
think that's all right.
That's all correct.

But the media has brought
some of this on ourselves.

And there's a reason that Bannon
and Trump want to attack us.

And it's because the
media is actually
less popular than Donald Trump.

And there's a reason for that.
I think you need to examine it.

CHRIS CUOMO: I don't know
that that's true, by the way.

ALISYN CAMEROTA: You're
citing that Gallup--

CHRIS CUOMO: Yeah.
I don't know that it's true.

I think these popularity
polls are a lot of air,
to be honest with you.
Do people love the media?

No, but the people
don't love anything.

Who's the most powerful
man in the world?
MATT LEWIS: Donald Trump.

CHRIS CUOMO: Who's the
biggest man in the room?
MATT LEWIS: Donald Trump.

CHRIS CUOMO: And
that's what you're
supposed to act like, right?

These are bully
tactics by somebody

who's showing insecurity
when he should

be the most secure person in
the United States of America.
